intro: Poissonella baillonii, commonly known as the Bailloni's poissonella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
